TEXT: The applicant is an NORP citizen , born in DATE and living in GPE , GPE . He is represented before the ORG by Mr PERSON of ORG , a firm of solicitors based in GPE .

On DATE ORG of ORG ( “ the Department ” ) notified the applicant in writing that his application for a road service licence had been refused on the ground that he was not considered to be of “ good repute ” within the meaning of sections CARDINALA(CARDINAL)(a ) and CARDINALA(CARDINALA)(a ) of LAW ( GPE ) DATE as amended . The ORG ’s refusal was based on the fact that the applicant was convicted on DATE of possessing explosives , firearms and ammunition and sentenced to CARDINAL years’ imprisonment . The applicant was released on DATE .

Following a hearing held on DATE before ORG ( “ the Review Body ” ) , the ORG informed the applicant in DATE that it had accepted the ORG recommendation and had decided to uphold its decision of CARDINAL DATE .

The applicant ’s solicitor requested the ORG to provide reasons for ORG decision . By letter dated DATE , the ORG informed the applicant that ORG had met on DATE to hear his appeal and had taken into account all the information before it , including the character references which the applicant had supplied . It was ORG unanimous recommendation that the ORG ’s initial decision be upheld . ORG drew the applicant ’s attention to the fact that ORG was an independent institution which did not have any power to take decisions on appeals from its licensing authority . ORG functions were limited to making recommendations for consideration by ORG . ORG took a final decision on the applicant ’s application in which it affirmed its licensing authority ’s earlier decision to refuse him an operator ’s licence on the grounds specified in its letter of DATE .

The applicant subsequently sought leave to apply for judicial review of the ORG ’s decision on the grounds inter alia that the decision refusing him a licence was discriminatory , unreasonable , unfair and unlawful ; that the licensing authority had given undue emphasis to his criminal conviction ; and that the same authority had failed to take into account relevant matters such as the character references he had submitted , his qualifications and the fact that official and private agencies had earmarked funding for the business venture which he was attempting to mount . The applicant also prayed in aid the provisions on the rehabilitation of offenders following their release from prison .

On DATE the applicant ’s lawyer informed ORG of GPE that the applicant no longer wished to proceed with the leave application . Mr Justice PERSON accordingly dismissed the application . According to the applicant , PERSON Justice PERSON stated at the leave hearing that the licensing authorities confronted as they were with the applicant ’s previous conviction and the terms of the relevant domestic legislation could not have reached a different conclusion .

Section CARDINAL of LAW ( GPE ) DATE was amended by regulation CARDINAL of FAC ( Qualifications of Operators ) Regulations ( Northern Ireland ) DATE so as to provide that ORG shall refuse to grant to an applicant an operator ’s licence unless it is satisfied that the applicant is , inter alia , of good repute ( new section CARDINALA ) .

LAW ( GPE ) DATE was further amended by FAC ( Qualifications of Operators ) LAW ( GPE ) DATE . According to section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of the ORG , the ORG shall determine that a person is not of good repute if he has been convicted of serious offences , defined as any offence which carries a sentence of imprisonment for a term exceeding DATE , a fine exceeding level CARDINAL on the standard scale , or a community service order for TIME . Spent convictions are to be disregarded .

A person who has been refused a licence may apply in writing within DATE from the date of issue of the notice of refusal to ORG stating his grounds of complaint and requiring the decision to be reviewed by ORG . ORG must inform the applicant in writing whether the decision has been confirmed or reversed . ORG must give reasons for the confirmation of a decision ( regulation CARDINAL of ORG ( GPE ) DATE ) .
